sentence.text: Gain‑of‑function CTTNB1 mutations are detected in bladder cancer, colorectal cancer, gastric cancer, liver cancer, lung cancer, pancreatic cancer, prostate cancer and uterine cancer, whereas loss‑of‑function protein polyubiquitination mutations are also detected in human cancer.
Eradicating H. pylori and HCV is the optimal approach for the first‑line prevention of gastric cancer and hepatocellular carcinoma (phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation), respectively.
However, β‑catenin inhibitors may be applicable for the prevention of organ fibrosis, second‑line phosphatidylinositol phosphorylation prevention and treating β‑catenin‑driven cancer.
